member.name: T:Dapper.CommandDefinition
member.summary: Represents the key aspects of a sql operation

member.summary: The command (sql or a stored-procedure name) to execute

member.summary: The parameters associated with the command

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.Transaction
member.summary: The active transaction for the command

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.CommandTimeout
member.summary: The effective timeout for the command

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.CommandType
member.summary: The type of command that the command-text represents

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.Buffered
member.summary: Should data be buffered before returning?

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.AddToCache
member.summary: Should the plan for this query be cached?

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.Flags
member.summary: Additional state flags against this command

member.name: P:Dapper.CommandDefinition.Pipelined
member.summary: Can async queries be pipelined?

member.summary: Initialize the command definition

The parameters for this command.
The transaction for this command to participate in.

The behavior flags for this command.
The cancellation token for this command.

member.summary: For asynchronous operations, the cancellation-token

member.name: T:Dapper.DbString
member.summary: This class represents a SQL string, it can be used if you need to denote your parameter is a Char vs VarChar vs nVarChar vs nChar

member.summary: Default value for IsAnsi.

member.name: F:Dapper.DbString.DefaultLength
member.summary: A value to set the default value of strings going through Dapper. Default is 4000, any value larger than this field will not have the default value applied.

member.summary: Create a new DbString

member.summary: The value of the string

member.summary: construct a dynamic parameter bag

member.summary: construct a dynamic parameter bag
member.param: can be an anonymous type or a DynamicParameters bag

member.name: M:Dapper.DynamicParameters.AddDynamicParams(System.Object)
member.summary: Append a whole object full of params to the dynamic EG: AddDynamicParams(new {A = 1, B = 2}) // will add property A and B to the dynamic

member.summary: Add a parameter to this dynamic parameter list.

The value of the parameter.
The type of the parameter.

The size of the parameter.

member.summary: Add a parameter to this dynamic parameter list.

The value of the parameter.
The type of the parameter.
The in or out direction of the parameter.
The size of the parameter.
The precision of the parameter.
The scale of the parameter.

member.name: P:Dapper.DynamicParameters.RemoveUnused
member.summary: If true, the command-text is inspected and only values that are clearly used are included on the connection

member.name: M:Dapper.DynamicParameters.AddParameters(System.Data.IDbCommand,Dapper.SqlMapper.Identity)
member.summary: Add all the parameters needed to the command just before it executes
member.param: The raw command prior to execution
Information about the query

member.name: P:Dapper.DynamicParameters.ParameterNames
member.summary: All the names of the param in the bag, use Get to yank them out

member.name: M:Dapper.DynamicParameters.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of a parameter
member.returns: The value, note DBNull.Value is not returned, instead the value is returned as null

member.name: M:Dapper.DynamicParameters.Output``1(``0,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}},System.Nullable{System.Data.DbType},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Allows you to automatically populate a target property/field from output parameters. It actually creates an InputOutput parameter, so you can still pass data in.
member.param: The object whose property/field you wish to populate.
A MemberExpression targeting a property/field of the target (or descendant thereof.)
The size to set on the parameter. Defaults to 0, or DbString.DefaultLength in case of strings.

member.name: T:Dapper.SqlMapper
member.summary: Dapper, a light weight object mapper for ADO.NET

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.QueryAsync(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Data.CommandType})
member.summary: Execute a query asynchronously using Task.
member.param: The connection to query on.
The SQL to execute for the query.
The parameters to pass, if any.
The transaction to use, if any.
The command timeout (in seconds).
The type of command to execute.
member.remarks: Note: each row can be accessed via "dynamic", or by casting to an IDictionary<string,object>

member.summary: Execute a query asynchronously using Task.

member.remarks: Note: each row can be accessed via "dynamic", or by casting to an IDictionary<string,object>

member.summary: Execute a query asynchronously using Task.
member.typeparam: The type of results to return.
member.param: The connection to query on.
The SQL to execute for the query.
The parameters to pass, if any.
The transaction to use, if any.
The command timeout (in seconds).
The type of command to execute.
member.returns: A sequence of data of ; if a basic type (int, string, etc) is queried then the data from the first column in assumed, otherwise an instance is created per row, and a direct column-name===member-name mapping is assumed (case insensitive).
